node.title: Major hotel chain only allowing fully vaccinated guests
node.description: The requirement will come into force when the new traffic light system comes into place.

node.title: Paine taking 'indefinite mental health break' from cricket
node.description: The former Australia test cricket captain Tim Paine is taking an "indefinite mental health break" from the game leaving Australia's Ashes preparations in disarray.

node.title: India on top in first test
node.description: India are in control after day one of the first Test against the Black Caps thanks to debutant's knock.

node.title: Sacking Foster as All Blacks coach would help arrest decline in NZ rugby
node.description: Opinion: You think this current situation with the All Blacks is bad? Heck, the next few years for rugby in New Zealand could be even worse, Hamish Bidwell writes.

node.title: Bridges believed to be firming up plans for tilt at leadership
node.description: Former leader Simon Bridges is throwing his hat in the ring to be National's leader, RNZ understands.

node.title: New mutated Covid-19 variant in South Africa
node.description: A newly identified coronavirus variant that has spread in South Africa has double the number of mutations of the Delta variant including some associated with evading immune response, British health…

node.title: Death toll soars to 52 in Russian coal mine accident - reports
node.description: At least 52 people are reported to have died in Russia's worst mining disaster in a decade.

node.title: 'No need to be alarmed' about new SA variant - Robertson
node.description: While there are no cases in NZ of the Covid-19 variant causing concern in South Africa, the deputy PM says it is a strong reminder that the global pandemic is far from over. Watch the govt's latest…

node.title: Medsafe staff on standby to work Christmas to analyse paediatric vaccine data
node.description: But experts say it's prudent to wait for more information before making a decision on vaccine approval for a population group where the chances of severe illness are slim.

node.title: New Zealand 'deeply concerned' over Solomon Islands riots
node.description: New Zealand's government has issued a statement expressing deep concern over rioting and unrest in the Solomon Islands, but saying no requests for assistance have yet been received.

node.title: Mixed feelings after Whangārei waterfront development rejected
node.description: The scrapping of Whangārei waterfront development plans have left some relieved and others resentful.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 173 new community cases, 78 people in hospital
node.description: The ministry says it was now supporting 4058 people to isolate at home around Auckland, including 1070 active cases.

node.title: DOC skipper ordered to pay $10k after jet boat hits kayaker
node.description: A DOC ranger has been ordered to pay more than $10,000 reparation after he plowed a jet boat into a kayaker, who suffered multiple injuries to their ribs, lungs and shoulder.

node.title: MetService issues rain warning for West Coast, warns of flooding, slips
node.description: Motorists in the West Coast are being urged to take care ahead of a deluge of rain expected there this weekend.

node.title: At least 52 dead in Russian mine collapse, officials say
node.description: The state Tass and RIA-Novosti news agencies cited emergency officials as saying that there was no chance of finding any more survivors in the Listvyazhnaya mine.

node.title: Iconic Chinese photographer apologises after controversy over 'insulting' image
node.description: A renowned Chinese fashion photographer apologises for her past work after online critics called it insulting to the Chinese people and fashion house Dior removed one of her photos from a show in Shanghai.

node.title: What are the rules in Tasmania if you are unvaxed when the borders open?
node.description: Tasmania's borders are opening and COVID-19 is coming, so what are the rules if you get infected and you are unvaccinated?

node.title: 'My son's the police minister. I'm pissed': Kenneth Grant found guilty of deadly 'sleepwalking' hit-run
node.description: The former police officer's defence over the hit-and-run death of a man was that he was sleepwalking and not conscious of his actions at the time. Today, a judge rejected that argument.

node.title: Solomon Islands PM's compound targeted by rioters, one building damaged by fire and looters
node.description: Prime Minister Sogavare's residence is under heavy police watch as protests continue for a third day, with more Australian police and troops to arrive in the capital, Honiara, later today.

node.title: Hong Kong records two cases of the new variant detected in South Africa.
node.description: The discovery could complicate efforts to reopen the border between the territory and the Chinese mainland.

node.title: Melbourne Storm NRL player charged by Queensland Police over alleged incident outside hotel
node.description: Tui Kamikamica has been stood down by the Melbourne Storm after being charged over an alleged incident involving a woman outside a Brisbane hotel.

node.title: Swimming Upstream in Heels and Skinny Pants
node.description: If I were a salmon, I would die for my child. As a human being, I wish I could have.

node.title: Your Friday Briefing
node.description: A concerning new variant.

node.title: Egypt unveils 3,000-year-old renovated Avenue of the Sphinxes in Luxor
node.description: Egyptian authorities unveil renovated ancient promenade in the city of Luxor that dates back 3,000 years.

node.title: Close Ashes selection call looms for 'good mates' Khawaja and Head
node.description: The Queensland and South Australian captains have made their cases for Ashes selection, with similar form lines this Sheffield Shield season.

node.title: Senior Rebels bikie arrested after alleged drug bust at his inner-city apartment
node.description: One of Canberra's most senior outlaw motorcycle gang members faces court after being arrested by police in the city's inner-north on Thursday night.

node.title: SA records two new cases of COVID-19 as 80 per cent vaccination milestone reached
node.description: South Australia records two new cases of COVID-19, as Premier Steven Marshall announces the state has reached 80 per cent double vaccination.

node.title: 17yo charged with murder of Central Queensland woman Rene Latimore
node.description: Police have charged a teenager with one count of murder, but have not yet revealed whether he was known to Ms Latimore.

node.title: New 'Heavily Mutated' COVID Variant Compels WHO to Call Special Meeting
node.description: An infectious diseases expert wrote that the variant "has mutations associated [with] reduced vaccine effectiveness."

node.title: AFL's rookie draft to give young players a second chance
node.description: Players who missed out in the AFL draft — and some delisted veterans — will be crossing their fingers for a lifeline in today's rookie and preseason drafts. Follow every pick live.
